info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 6:37AM EDT until June 14 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CATAWBA...CENTRAL MCDOWELL...ALEXANDER...MITCHELL... NORTHWESTERN IREDELL...CALDWELL...AVERY...NORTHEASTERN YANCEY AND BURKE COUNTIES... At 637 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Taylorsville to 7 miles west of Lenoir to near Newland to 9 miles north of Burnsville, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Lenoir, Morganton, Spruce Pine, Taylorsville, Burnsville, Newland, St. Stephens, Longview and Sawmills. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
